abstract.p: Following communication from a carpenter called Hamid, Purshottam Das is granted a house, but he is instructed to demolish it, then send the wood to the authorities and pay 150 rupees as tribute.

div.p:
زبدة الاقران پرسوتم چودری پرگنه دهار بعنایت و مهربانی امیدوار
بوده بداند که درینولا حامد معمار بعرض رساند که او خدمت خوب کرده
مجری او شد حسب الالتماس او حویلی که در آنجا بولاقیچند می بود
باو مرحمت فرمودیم باید که بموجب قرار داد خود حویلی مذکور مسمار نموده
چوب آنچه باشد بحضور برساند و مرمت پشت تالاب بعهده خود
دانسته زود سرانجام دهد و مبلغ یکصد و پنجاه روپیه که
برای حویلی مذکور پیشکش قرار کرده بحضور ارسال نماید
و در دولتخواهی و کفایت سرکار و تردد آبادانی و کشتکار
زراعت خود را معاف و مقصر ندارد درین باب
نهایت تاکید دانسته از فرموده تخلف نورزد
تحریر فی التاریخ
۲۸ ذی قعده سنه ۱۰۷۰
فقط فقط

حسب المسطور مقرر شناسد تاکید
تمام دارند فقط

div.p:
Eminent among Contemporaries Purshottam [Das] chaudhri of pargana Dhar, having hoped for kindness,
should know that recently the builder Hamid has petitioned that having done good work,
he has completed the job. According to his petition, I have kindly given the house over there that used to belong to Bulaqi Chand
to him [i.e. Purshottam Das].Grammatically, it is unclear to whom the pronoun او in 'his petition' and 'to him' refer. Based on social status and the subsequent document regarding the grant of a house, it appears the house was given to Purshottam Das. It is necessary that according to his own agreement, the said house should be destroyedIt is very strange that the order is to destroy a house but the order is similar to that in '1660 Order of Nawazish Khan to Purshottam Das granting a house'. Perhaps old houses were being destroyed. [and]
whatever wood is available is sent to the Lord, and knowing the repair of the rear of the tank as his own responsibility,
he shall finish the work quickly. And he shall send 150 rupees,
which is settled as the tribute for the house, to his Lordship.
And in the loyalty and support of the government and the organization of populating and agriculture,
he shall not consider himself exempt in the least. Knowing this matter
to be fully settled, do not neglect to do what is ordered.
Written on the date of 28 Zi al-qaʿda [in the] year 1070. Nothing further. Nothing further.

Know all that is written to be settled and
fully confirmed. Nothing further.Near this authorisation an office note on the verso appears faintly. However, an image of the verso was not supplied so this note cannot be read.
